entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM(Health Monitoring):Number of User
entry.content:
Dear CustomerÔºå

 

Thanks for your patience.

"Number of Users" metric under HM indicates the Total number of currently active user sessions in the system.

I'm checked internally for the "UserType" info under Health Monitoring:

  • Dialog‚ÜíGUI in AL08
  • RFC‚ÜíRFC in AL08
  • CONCUR‚Üí user count after remove the duplicates. 
    This should not be calculated to the "Number of Users". see details under KBA 3522884 



Please feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to delete fs item
entry.content: we got support from SAP to solve this one. On our current code level only role IDs are stored in tables TF692, TF602, TF696 and TF140. However, in earlier versions (which we started on originally), fs item IDs were stored. After the update, these fs item IDs are still in the tables but are not updated anymore.

entry.title: Issue with Missing Records in CDS Table Function (ABAP 7.50 / HANA)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm hoping someone here can help me with a problem I‚Äôm facing.

I‚Äôve been asked to provide data for a report that should show the date of the last document for each customer. I planned to implement this using a CDS view. However, since we are still on ABAP release 7.50, I don‚Äôt have access to the latest CDS View features.

To work around this, I tried using a CDS Table Function to retrieve the data. Unfortunately, I noticed that some records are missing. When I run the same SELECT statement in the SQL Console, I get a result for a specific customer ‚Äì but that same record is not returned by the Table Function.

The data does exist in the underlying tables, so I‚Äôm wondering:
Why is the record not returned by the Table Function?

I‚Äôm aware that there are differences between Open SQL and SQLScript used in Table Functions, but I would have expected the Table Function to return at least the same or more data ‚Äì not less.

We are running ABAP 7.50 on a HANA database.

OpenSQL:

SQLScript:

‚ÄÉ

‚ÄÉ

Any ideas or explanations would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: BoE ‚Äì AP: Why Can‚Äôt We Set Maturity Date per Supplier Master ?
entry.content:
Dear expert, 

I‚Äôm reaching out to seek clarification regarding the handling of Bills of Exchange (BoE) due dates (maturity dates) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

Based on our testing and the SAP Knowledge Base Article [2837406 ‚Äì Due Date in Manage Automatic Payments for BOE Outgoing Payments], we understand that the BoE due date can either be manually entered during the automatic payment run or derived from the invoice due date, depending on the configuration setup shown in the KBA above. 

However, in our case, BoE maturity terms (e.g., 45, 60, or 90 days) are typically defined in individual supplier contracts and therefore differ from one vendor to another. As these terms are vendor-specific and contractually agreed, it would be both practical and efficient to maintain the BoE maturity term directly within the supplier master data. Doing so would enable the system to automatically apply the correct maturity during BoE processing, ensuring consistency and minimizing manual input.

Therefore, I would like to understand why SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) does not currently support storing BoE maturity terms per supplier in the supplier master.

I kindly request your support in addressing the following:

  • Could you clarify why the system does not allow BoE maturity terms (e.g., 60 days) to be maintained per supplier?

  • Are there any planned enhancements in this area, or possible workarounds (such as using custom fields or extensibility features)?

  • What are the recommended best practices for handling BoE AP in scenarios where maturity terms are supplier-specific?

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
HY

entry.title: Re: CCM: Block condition contract after final settlement...
entry.content:
With Status Profile, you can achieve this.
Go to SPRO > Logistics - General > Settlement Management > Condition Contract Management > Condition Contract Maintenance > Define Condition Contract Types.  Assign a Status Profile that includes a status like ‚ÄúFinal Settled‚Äù or ‚ÄúLocked‚Äù. Configure the status to restrict further processing (e.g., prevent changes or new settlements)

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Iterative Prioritization
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need some suggestion and perspective advise on below calculation logic.

We have some car plate codes ( VLK_PRJ ) and each plate code has relavant customer code assigned in its masterdata as well as contract starting date. As the first step, I generate mapping combination with VLK_PRJ, Date ( Contract starting date ), and relavant customer code ( VLK_CUS ) and entrytype ( VLK_ETYPE ) as I_MAPPING which means mapping coming from integration.

Then, those values are shown to users, and they might enter some adjustments for customer assignments ( assuming the car will be given service to another customer in the future ). I keep those entries with entrytype A_MAPPING ( adjusted mapping ).

What I want to achieve is creating C_MAPPING records ( calculated mapping ) starting from the contract starting date until the end of planning date coming from version attribute. For this calculation I have below rules. Also, I have 21 customer in masterdata, and around 450 plate codes.

  1. If both A_MAPPING and I_MAPPING exists with the same combination of VLK_PRJ and Date, then I_MAPPING is ignored.
  2. If multiple combinations are entered for the same combination of VLK_PRJ and date, then the first customer code will be used, rest will not be considered. ( I know this might be handled from input screen, but let's assume user entered multiple combination by mistake )
  3. If there is no mapping entry for the further periods ( I_MAPPING only exists for the starting date, and no A_MAPPING is entered for the next period ), then duplicate it from preivous period as it is.

Please find below script which works as expected but it takes more than 3 mins which is too long I believe. I have 3 blocks of calculations, improvements or different approach for any part is appreciated.

CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = OFF

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "SDATA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/START] TO [d/Version].[p/END]
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_ETYPE] = ("A_MAPPING", "C_MAPPING", "I_MAPPING")
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_PRJ] = BASEMEMBER([d/VLK_PRJ], "PLAKA_AKTIF")

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/VLK_DET], [d/VLK_PCTR]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_DET] = "#"
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_PCTR] = "#"

VARIABLEMEMBER #MAPPING_FLAG OF [d/VLK_ETYPE]

INTEGER @LV_CHECK
INTEGER @LV_COUNTER
INTEGER @i
INTEGER @LV_PREV_MONTH

DELETE([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") //clear previously calculated mapping

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING" THEN //mapping adjustments
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]
		FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_CUS] ASC
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() //only apply the first customer if multiple adjustments are entered for the same project time combination
			BREAK //do not proceed further
		ENDFOR
	ENDFOR

ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "I_MAPPING" THEN // mapping values coming from integration
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]

		@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
		@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING") // check if there is an adjustment entry
		IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN // if there is no adjustment entry
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() // get whatever is coming from integration ( only 1 customer mapping is coming already from integration )
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING" THEN // output mapping entrytype
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date] ASC //start from the first month of mapping entry of the project
		
		// if no mapping is processed before, process further.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = NULL THEN 
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = 1 // flag mapping as processed for the project

			@LV_COUNTER = DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/Version].[p/END], "MONTH")
			IF @LV_COUNTER > 0 THEN //check if not at the last month already
				FOR @I = 1 TO @LV_COUNTER  // start from the next month
					@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
					@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) // check if there is mapping entry for the next month
					IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN //if there is no mapping for the next month, get it from previous month
						
						@LV_PREV_MONTH = @I - 1
						DATA([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@LV_PREV_MONTH, "MONTH", [d/Date]))

					ENDIF
				ENDFOR
			ENDIF
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Thanks,

Volkan

entry.title: Re: Problem at task TS00300058 in the workflow WS00300022.
entry.content: Although it's an ancient post, I had the same issue, and I like to provide a more precise answer. My result is that the task TS00300058 is defined as a background task, whereas the method STATUSCHANGE uses the FM AIA1_REQUEST_STATUS_CHANGE, which attempts to call screens in the background. This results in dumps to program SAPMSSY1 with exception DYNPRO_NOT_FOUND, which initially makes it unclear in ST22 where the error occurred. A deeper look is necessary.

entry.title: Re: How can we know the number of customer invoices sent...
entry.content:
You need to develop a custom report considering tables like VBRK, NAST, ADR6 & VBPA.


Filter logic should be based on

  1. the Partner Function to ZM in VBPA
  2. billing date from VBRK for the specific year
  3. email address from ADR6 table
  4. Output type (ex.medium = 5 for email) and Status = Successfully processed from NAST.  The status would be helpful to exclude failed emails

Hi Aqua, was this limitation introduced recently? Previously tables in form INPUTS could be mapped to any list variable regardless of the name or fields (by binding it to the variable), and after binding we were able to map individual fields to the fields in the variable. The limitation you talk about applied (afaik) to form OUTPUTS, where mapping a table to a variable requires them to have the same exact structure. Was this changed recently?

Thanks, Alessandro

entry.title: Re: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content:
Your custom routine is not working because, during repricing either in sales order or billing, SAP re-evaluates pricing conditions but Requirement routines may not re-trigger unless explicitly coded to do so. KZWIx may not be populated yet when the requirement runs or z002 might not be active or calculated at the time when z001's requirement is evaluated.

What you can do is assign the custom routine to z001 (if not already done). This should check if z002 is present in xkomv. Compare its value to komp-kzwi3. Returns TRUE only if z002 > kzwi3.

Additionally, in your pricing procedure, z002 should be placed before z001 so its value is available. Use Subtotal column for z002 to store its value in KZWI3

entry.title: Re: Datasphere - Association to a dimension with input pa...
entry.content:
How to solve "Parameter cannot be added" error:
* Delete all upstream associations,
* Add parameter in affected table and use it
* Re-create all upstream associations

entry.title: Re: Derived Events- How to Trigger Custom Event from an SAP Standard Event
entry.content:
Hello @LakshmiHari 

Unfortunately, the APIs in OP and Cloud are not the same. you need to check the interface in your system to see if the statement 'use event change' exist there or not. if not, then creating the derived event is not possible because the content that is required on the interfaces simply does not exists. 

Only option here is to create a customer influence request and waiting that it will be implemented (which takes time).

Best regards

Safa

entry.title: Re: Best Practice - SAP EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
Hi @Michael_Hoppe 
thanks for having a look at my issue.  That's exactly what I found out yesterday evening after some more investigation.
Problem was caused by our solution manager üôÑ:  It was caused by a blocked lock entry  in SM12, which was caused by a process cancellation during  job /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR on 03.07.25. SDCCN Task log showed "Enqeue for category failed" 

After old SM12 from /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR was removed, /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR could do its work and sent all reports to SAP. EWA Workspace has some new data now üôÇ.
Because the data from Rise Systems comes another way the data was there, while the other was missing

entry.title: Innovate globally with two new SAP Business Technology Platform regions on Amazon Web Services
entry.content:
Innovate globally with two new SAP Business Technology Platform regions on Amazon Web Services

 

We‚Äôre excited to announce that SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) is now available in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) region ‚ÄúUS West (Oregon)‚Äù and will be available on AWS in Milan later this year. This follows up on our announcement to further expand the regional availability of SAP BTP at the SAP TechEd conference in October 2024. In total, SAP BTP will be offered in 11 AWS regions globally.

Benefits

As part of SAP‚Äôs ongoing efforts to expand its data center footprint, we are enabling customers in more regions to innovate with SAP BTP. With this, there will be 2 SAP BTP regions available in the US (Virginia and Oregon) and in Europe (Frankfurt and Milan) on AWS infrastructure, which will also be enabled to act as cross region disaster recovery sites for HANA Cloud.

In addition, the expanded availability is especially beneficial for RISE with SAP customers. It offers additional options to select a SAP BTP region close to core business systems like S/4HANA.

And of course, SAP and AWS will continue to work on new joint innovations to benefit customers. For example, SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub allows you to access a variety of LLMs such as Amazon Bedrock models to streamline core business processes, all within a modern, intelligent, and collaborative user experience. SAP and AWS also launched a new AI Co-Innovation Program to help partners build generative artificial intelligence applications with SAP Generative AI Hub and Amazon Bedrock. Check out this announcement to learn more!

 

Scope & Timeline

SAP and AWS are targeting to deploy SAP BTP in the following two AWS Regions:

  • US West - Oregon, available as of now
  • Milan, to be available in H2/2025

You can also find the latest updates on planned timelines for new deployments in the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

A detailed overview about all SAP BTP services offered on AWS can be found on SAP Discovery Center.

 

SAP and AWS Partnership

Businesses have been running enterprise applications from SAP on AWS cloud infrastructure since 2008. SAP BTP, in conjunction with AWS, provides a simplified architectural approach to embrace a clean core by providing a framework for application development, integration and analytics as an integrated extension to the ERP core to drive benefits including accelerated migrations, business process automation and 360¬∞ analytics. Today, SAP operates in 35 AWS regions and manages thousands of AWS accounts. SAP is committed to providing its innovative technology to its customers around the globe. We look forward to working with AWS as a strategic partner to continue serving our joint customers. Learn more about our partnership here!

 

Learn More

Are you ready to embark on a digital transformation to improve organizational agility and resilience? Learn how SAP BTP and AWS can accelerate innovation and unlock business potential with enterprise-ready capabilities like application development, integration, data and analytics and AI. Check out SAP Discovery Center and implement your use cases on SAP BTP with step-by-step guidance and well established support from topic experts and the SAP community!

entry.title: SAP Fiori application - Accrual Postings Simulated Posted simulated measures
entry.content:
Hello

I would like to know, for the Fiori Application Accrual Postings Simulated Posted, how the measures "Simulated A/D Amt" are fed for the report. 

Which SAP tables or fields are data source for theses measures ?

Thanks in advance

Pierre

entry.title: Headcount Story Report
entry.content:
Hi,

does anyone of you have any experience with Headcount Story Reports that after some organizational changes somehow in the Story additional employees are added to the headcount for previous months?

E.g. from January to April there was 64-66 employees.

But from 1st of May there was change in the structure so for May we have 86 employees. 

When I'm generating the report for May I've noticed that for previous months I don't have 64-66 employees but there is more employees - some employees were added. 

Any idea why it can happen?

Thank you and regards,

Aneta

SAP SuccessFactors People Analytics

entry.title: Re: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
Nope. Could you provide a Minimal Reproducible Example that people can run and tell your ABAP version?

REPORT.
CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS constructor.
    DATA a TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS ltc_app DEFINITION FINAL
  FOR TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS first_test FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS lcl_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD constructor.
    IF sy-uzeit < '120000'.
      a = 1.
    ELSE.
      a = 2.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS ltc_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD first_test.
    DATA(app) = NEW lcl_app( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Re: Is there a standard query to get the conversion rates...
entry.content:
Hello @gunesbt ,

yes, there is a standard way, to solve this problem...

First you need an ODP source system for you own BW (here: "BWH") - not the regular BI system:

On this source system you create a custom Datasource which reads from BW table TCURR.

Then you include this Datasource in an Open ODS View.

In SAC, when you are in your Currency Table in SAC, you can directly use the Open ODS View as source for loading the data via the BW connection. 

For exceptional queries (TCURX), like e.g. CLP ... it might be that the value in SAC is not correct.

This needs probably a BW query, instead of the Open ODS view alone.

But what I summarize here is based on a word documentation of myself from 2020 üòâ ... so might be different today.

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Different behavior when submiting and calling transac...
entry.content:
VL10B calls program RVV50R10_PRESTEP, which in turn calls RVV50R10C. It skips the initial screen and uses predefined parameters or user profiles, whereas, program RVV50R10C displays the selection screen and processes deliveries based on input criteria. When run directly, it behaves like a standalone report.
Having said that, when you run the program, you get the full selection screen and can manually enter parameters. It doesn‚Äôt inherit the user role profile, default filters, or variant logic that VL10B applies automatically.

If you're seeing different delivery creation results, it's likely because VL10B applies filters or logic that aren't active when you run RVV50R10C directly. VL10B might exclude blocked orders or apply a specific delivery creation horizon, while RVV50R10C processes everything based on what you manually input.

entry.title: Whether Tax amount will be included Inventory Cost in US procurement process.
entry.content:
Whether inventory cost in every US procurement will include the tax amount? 

Tried with other region like Japan, Australia and Singapore, but is there any possibility that country US having this scenario of Tax inclusion in the inventory cost.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Whether Tax amount will be included Inventory Cost in...
entry.content: Basically the inventory cost represents the value assigned to a material's quantity held in stock. It's calculated by multiplying the inventory quantity by the inventory cost per unit. Ideally tax cannot be included here because this cost is used to determine the value of inventory and to value movements of the material.

entry.title: Re: Which Certification is beneficial along with SAP IBP?
entry.content:
Hi @Mukesh_Bhutekar 
Please check our SAP CERTIFICATION C_IBP SAP Certified Associate - SAP IBP for Supply Chain site.
This certification verifies that you posses the core skills in the area of the SAP supply chain planning and proves that you have an overall understanding within this consultant profile of the industry solutions, and can implement this skills practically in projects under the guidance of an experienced consultant. It is recommended as an entry-level qualification to allow consultants to get acquainted with the the cores of SAP Integrated Business Planning.
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Withholding tax for customer invoice in Italy #COE#RFL01
entry.content:
Since this is a legal requirement, you can submit an Expert Configuration request to SAP via the support portal.

Now, coming to your requirement on the sales side, if the required configuration is missing, you can do on your own.
Create a condition type and set to statistical, to calculate the withholding tax amount. By setting the condition type as statistical, it won't have any financial impact but you can make the value visible in invoice output. On the other hand, if your Business stakeholders from Finance side agree to have this financial posting, either you don't mark as statistical or set to Accrual depending upon the Business requirement. One advantage of setting the condition type as accrual is, when an incoming payment is posted, this value can also be adjusted parallelly and you have a track on this.

entry.title: Datasphere - HANA Cloud DB Remote Table (Insufficient privileges on HDI)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have created a connection in Datasphere to visualize the access to a HANA Cloud DB.

The set up is correct and we are able to import the relevant tables as remote tables but when we are trying to view the data we are getting the error as follows:

internal error: Error opening the cursor for the remote database <DWC_IL_BTP_HANA_APPS_EU.HANA_BTP_APPS_EU> [SAP AG][LIBODBCHDB SO][HDBODBC] General error;258 insufficient privilege: Detailed info for this error can be found with guid 'E3A628E32FA90D4B90B99370A3C9CBC4'

The issue is due to insufficient privileges of the user used in the Datasphere connection (DBAMIN) to access the HDI container where the table exist.

I understand that to solve the issue we need to assigned SELECT privilege to DBADMIN on the respective schema but, how can we do that?

Note that the HDI container has been created over an MTA so not sure how we can do to grant that permission.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: Re: Session 1 Recap & Highlights‚Äì Data Inspired ‚Äì Successful concepts for data-driven organizati
entry.content:
‚ÄòIt is thus evident that the value of ICT as enabler of service of service delivery will not be realised without incorporating governance of ICT in the corporate governance regime of a department.‚Äô

The Context of Alignment 

 

Alignment is the delivery of required results.

To line up IT with business plans requires the adoption of a language used in dealing with financial matters. Alignment is the capacity to demonstrate a positive relationship between information technologies and the accepted measures of performance.  Computer investments must show as enhancements to a business plan. Executives should measure what, how and when it supports improvements in the delivery of operating results.

What is alignment?

 

Aligning information systems to corporate goals has emerged as the number one concern for over a decade(s) in surveys of information systems executives. For the public sector it means support in the delivery of superior services to the public.

 

Expectations must precede the choice of technologies

 

To achieve alignment, one must first identify the sources of misalignment. If profitability or performance does not meet expectations, there must be enumerable reasons why this is so. There is no point in picking the latest technologies as a remedy, if the problem is curable by changing management practices.  Such action may not require computers at all. It may call for investing in people rather than technology. How much to spend comes only after one answers; What are the benefits?.

In the absence of trustworthy metrics, the current corporate and public sector practice is not to budget computers according to specified results, but according to the perceived needs of its proponents. (It follows the bureaucrat‚Äôs first principle of keeping a job: Do not commit to what you will deliver, but insist on getting what you ask for).  Consultants and government bureaucrats reinforce this bias by offering advice on best practices for managing inputs in the hope that it will somehow yield superior outputs.

The effects of IT investments are observable only by comparing how a particular organisation performs differently with or without added computer investments.

 A difference between top-performing organisations and their competitors is the ability to generate large returns on IT investments. The difference can be traced to effective usage of IT governance to support business strategies. Effective IT governance consists of leadership and organisational structures and processes that ensure that the organisation‚Äôs IT sustains and extends the organisation‚Äôs strategies and objectives.

The governance structures (decision-making structures such as committees, councils and senior management roles) act like the Social Operating Mechanism (SOM) of the organisation, ensuring information flow, working relationships, transparency and cross - functional collaboration. Along with the processes and communication tools, they act like the social operating system of the organisation, driving its culture and embedding it in the DNA of the organisation by promoting proper accountability, desirable behaviours and cultural values.

Once the governance structures, processes and tools are deployed and institutionalised within the organisation, silos and redundancies are eliminated. Accountabilities, roles and responsibilities are firmly established. The business units within the organisation are better able to exchange information, align and collaborate efficiently.

The organisation becomes lean, mean and more efficient. This leads to effectiveness in the overall governance, performance and productivity of the organisation.

The Five IT Governance Focus Areas

 

The purpose of IT governance can be categorised by the five IT governance focus areas, which encompass the entire gamut of scope and issues that management needs to address in order to govern IT effectively:

  • Strategic alignment:
    • Ensure alignment among IT and business unit goals.
    • Perform strategic and tactical planning to align to business requirements so that IT does not work in silos.
  • Value delivery:
    • Deliver high-quality work and exploit opportunities.
    • Manage, deliver and maximise business benefits and value.
    • Ensure that business requirements are met.
  • Risk management:
    • Institute a risk management framework to embed risk management responsibilities in the organisation.
    • Manage and remediate risk factors and issues, including risk and issue assessment, alignment, awareness, analysis, response and monitoring.
  • Resource management:
    • Manage IT resource demand and supply effectively and efficiently.
    • Ensure on-time procurement and supply of resources.
  • Performance measurement:
    • Measure, monitor and control IT performance using appropriate metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs). This can be done by instituting an IT balanced scorecard.
    • Continually improve IT performance to achieve business requirements and goals.

IT Governance Model Problem

 

In obsolete and ineffective governance models, the governance structures are not balanced, not set up properly and/or do not function properly. This leads to ineffective social operating mechanisms (SOM) of the organisation, resulting in a lack of communication, collaboration and dissemination of information flow.

Consequently, the different business units and functions of the organisation do not share information effectively because they work and function in a siloed manner. A duplication of roles and responsibilities among the different functions and business units of the organisation ensues and, as a result, leads to high operating costs and lower margins. In short, the organisation functions in a reactive manner and is slow to respond to macro and micro economic changes.

Thus, the major problems noted due to ineffective (or even the absence of) governance models are:

  • A siloed IT organisation with misalignment among IT and business unit goals
  • Lack of accountability and ownership
  • Limited and ineffective communications
  • Ineffective risk and issue management
  • Poor-quality deliverables
  • Customer dissatisfaction

Other problems frequently encountered include:

  • Failure to deliver promised benefits
  • Return on investment (ROI) different than expected
  • Ending projects prematurely
  • Serious operational IT incidents

  ‚ÄòRealm of Possibility‚Äô

 

It is important for the organisation to become a lean, mean and well-oiled machine. In support toward this ontological approach, redesigning or modernising governance models is necessary.

The major task while redesigning governance models is to ensure ownership, accountability, communication, cross- functional collaboration, and alignment between the business and IT. Many times governance models are implemented, but miss the big picture by focusing on a few important requirements and missing the others.

The ontological approach is uniquely effective in providing actionable access to being a leader and exercising leadership effectively. While ontology as a general subject is concerned with the being of anything, here we are concerned with the ontology of human beings (the nature and function of being for human beings). Specifically, we are concerned with the ontology of leader and leadership (the nature and function of being for a leader and the actions of effective leadership).

 

When one is being,  a leader shapes one‚Äôs perceptions, emotions, creative imagination, thinking, planning, and consequently one‚Äôs actions in the exercise of leadership.

 

 

 

Being a leader and the effective exercise of leadership as one‚Äôs natural self-expression does not come from learning and trying to emulate the characteristics or styles of noteworthy leaders, or learning what effective leaders do and trying to emulate them (and most certainly not from merely being in a leadership position, or position of authority).

If you are not being a leader and you try to act like a leader, you are likely to fail. That‚Äôs called being inauthentic (playing a role or pretending to be a leader), deadly in any attempt to exercise leadership.

An epistemological mastery of a subject leaves you knowing. An ontological mastery of a subject leaves you being.

Gaining access to being a leader and the effective exercise of leadership as one‚Äôs natural self-expression also requires dealing with those factors present in all human beings that constrain each person‚Äôs freedom to be ‚Äì and constrain and shape one‚Äôs perceptions, emotions, creative imagination, thinking, planning, and actions. When one is not constrained or shaped by these factors ‚Äì what we term ‚Äúontological constraints‚Äù ‚Äì one‚Äôs way of being and acting results naturally in one‚Äôs personal best. We work with the public sector staff so that they accomplish this for themselves.

The Underlying Theory

  

Three Foundational Elements of Leadership

Integrity (in our model a positive phenomenon):

  • Being whole and complete ‚Äì achieved by ‚Äúhonouring one‚Äôs word‚Äù (creates workability, develops trust).

Authenticity:

  • Being and acting consistent with who you hold yourself out to be for others and who you hold yourself to be for yourself. When leading, being authentic leaves you grounded and able to be straight without using force.

Being Committed to Something Bigger than Oneself:

  • Source of the serene passion (charisma) required to lead and to develop others as leaders and the source of persistence (joy in the labour of) when the path gets tough.

 

The other main components to address in the design of the governance models are:

  • Governance structures‚ÄîAlso known as governance forums or decision-making structures, these include forums, accountabilities, roles and responsibilities. As mentioned earlier, governance structures facilitate communication, decision making and collaboration among the different business units of the organisation. Without governance structures, the organisation essentially functions in silos.
  • Alignment processes‚ÄîThese processes include strategic, operational, people and exception-handling processes. Alignment processes ensure compliance with policies and provide valuable input for decision making.
  • Metrics‚ÄîMetrics help in measuring, monitoring and tracking the projects as well as their business value. Both the KPIs and key goal indicators (KGIs) are useful. KPIs help alert the organisation to potential problems early on, and KGIs indicate whether the goals are being met.
  • Communication approaches‚ÄîInstitutionalisation is directly proportional to the amount of communication carried out. Effective communication ensures successful institutionalisation of IT governance and desirable behaviours within the organisation. Toward this objective, communication needs to be completed using a variety of channels, including town-hall meetings, emails, web portals, one-on-one meetings, team meetings and governance forums. Repeated communication is also essential to reinforce the messages.

The objective of the governance models is to improve and standardise the components to achieve the business unit objectives. What is needed is a framework on which the components of the governance models can be built to ensure consideration of the entire gamut of requirements. The five IT governance focus areas (strategic alignment, value delivery, risk management, resource management and performance measurement) described earlier come into play since they describe the main perspectives and requirements that IT management needs to manage and govern effectively to create a balanced system.

Inability to address any of the above and five IT governance focus areas will lead to an unbalanced system and problems later on, as shown in the following examples:

 

 

  • If adequate governance structures do not exist, the organisation‚Äôs social operating systems will not function effectively. If governance structures do not exist for performance measurement, the different business units of the organisation will not collaborate effectively and exchange information to measure and manage performance.
  • If metrics do not exist for strategic alignment or risk management, alignment or risk problems will not be known early.
  • If processes do not exist for resource management, problems in resource demand and supply may not be known.

Benefits distinguish Leadership

 

Redesigning governance models by taking into consideration the five IT governance focus areas (strategic alignment, value delivery, risk management, resource management and performance measurement) leads to the following benefits:

  • Governance structures, roles, responsibilities, alignment processes and metrics to address issues under the five IT governance focus areas
  • Removal of silos between the business units of the organisation, leading to effective communication and collaboration
  • Better scope and requirements management
  • Effective measurement, monitoring and management
  • Higher quality of deliverables
  • Customer satisfaction
  • Effective risk and issue management
  • Better decision making
  • A proactive organisation that is quick in responding to market and internal changes

The end result is that the organisation has a balanced social operating system. Effective governance structures, alignment processes and communication approaches result in fluent collaboration, dissemination of information and removal of silos. Consequently, better decisions are made and the organisation becomes proactive in dealing with the macro- and micro economic changes. Thus, the organisation becomes agile, healthy, lean and more productive.

entry.title: picking strategy with quantity classification - PAL CAR EA
entry.content:
Hello,

i hope this is still active. I am configuring a quantity classification PICK strategy in S4 EWM. I have 3 classifications, P(PAL), C(CAR) and 1(EA). This used to work until EWM 9.5, but when I tried this in S4 EWM, PAL is working fine, but for CAR, I always get a decimal carton quantity.

For example, the material has the following UOM: 

PAL = 100 EA

CAR = 10 EA

 

Delivery Quantity is 112 EA. Expectation is to split this into the following breakdown:

P = 100 EA (or 1PAL)

C= 10EA (or 1 CAR)

1 = 2 EA

The actual result is:

P = 100 EA (or 1PAL)

C = 12 EA (1.2 CAR)

I wonder why the CAR classification is getting the remaining 12 EA, when it should be getting 10EA only. Is it a standard bug?

Current Configuration

Packspec - I have 3 levels, EA, CAR and PAL. Each level has quantity classification active with condition record for task Creation (0WHT).

Process Type - WPT 2010 is set to rounding rule = 3 (round down to multiples of a unit)

Pick Strategy - I set 3 different search strategy for each classification

When I check the logs of WT creation, it correctly reads the configuration, but the remaining quantity is being assigned to CAR classification even if it has loose quantity intended for other search strategy.

I hope someone can enlighten.

entry.title: E:SDDL_PARSER_MSG:542 PROVIDER CONTRACT 785
entry.content:
I have developed Root view and on top of which I want to define Projection View, But I encouter error as  E:SDDL_PARSER_MSG:542 PROVIDER CONTRACT 785 , help me to fix this issue. Iam on S4 2020.

@EndUserText.label: 'Projection View for Holiday Block'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@Search.searchable: true

define root view entity ZHLD_CUST_BLOCK_C

provider contract transactional_query

as projection on ZHOLIDAY_BLOCK_ROOT

{

key Customer,

key Salorg,

key DistChn,

key Div,

CustomerName1,

CustomerName2,

CustDelBlock,

Text,

StartDate,

EndDate

}
